doc.previous: There are specialized area of fire and rescue operations that are considered special operations. These areas may require schools and classes to be attended for subject specific training.[6][7]
doc.after: Firefighters usually follow the 24 hour shift schedule. Some fire departments work 8, or 12 hour shifts but the 24 hour shift is more common.[8] Australian firefighters work a 10/14 shift in which the day shift works 10 hours and the night shift works 14 hours.[9]
